blog.name: captainrogerrsbeard
blog.title: We love who we love. Sucks.
blog.description: 33·Wife·Mom·Writer/ Masterlist/Buy me a coffee ☕️

summary: Plot: reader won the red carpet omaze thing  Chris expected everything: some guy, a normal fan, a crazy fangirl that would grope...
question: Plot: reader won the red carpet omaze thing  Chris expected everything: some guy, a normal fan, a crazy fangirl that would grope him with every chance she got but when he actually saw the winner he couldn't help himself thinking the beautiful girl in front of him exactly looked like a Disney princess.
answer:
“Chris! The winner and guest will be here in five minutes! They’re en route,” his publicist gave him the warning he’d asked for in preparation. While this wasn’t his first time with a winner of a contest, it didn’t make it any less nerve wracking. He never knew what he was going to get. It was always an adventure.

Finishing up with two more short red carpet interviews as they waited, he got word the winner had arrived. Following his team to the meeting point off the carpet, shimmery gold caught his eye as he approached.

For all he had anticipated, this was something else.

The woman was certainly dressed for a premiere. The gold dress sparkled in the LA sunshine. Off the shoulder and elegant. Hair swept up in curls, off her neck, her profile full of distinct features that drew him closer. She was laughing and smiling with her guest but his eyes never made it that far. They stayed pinned to her. She looked like a Disney princess attending a ball.

Prompted by his manager, pointing his way, she turned and they made eye contact. He smiled, out of pure instinct, as she smiled in return. He could tell it was a nervous one, her cheeks red as he finally closed the distance between them.

“Hey there,” he greeted politely with a small wave. She took one step, extending her hand as if to shake his but she tripped. Unceremoniously and wide-eyed she was falling toward him. He caught her as gently and appropriately as he could. They ended up chest to chest, her hands on his arms, his hands on the middle of her back.

“Oh gosh – hi! I’m so sorry,” she stumbled over her words but he just laughed kindly. She was positively radiant.

“Don’t be. Happens to the best of us. I’m Chris. It’s a pleasure to meet you….”

blog.name: hlkwrites
blog.title: writing at night
blog.description: why do you write like you need it to survive?

summary: The Thirst of Your Soul - Part 3
title: The Thirst of Your Soul - Part 3
body:
Chris Evans, not just a snack but a 4 course meal with coffee and mints.  

Taking my best friend to my little sisters wedding should be simple right? Well, it wont be.

Thursday morning rolled around far faster than I thought it would, before I knew it Chris was calling me telling me he was outside and waiting for me. I had packed and repacked my bag a dozen times in the last three days and the mess in my bedroom and in the living room was evidence to that fact, but my case was finally packed and I was as ready as I was ever going to be.

I heaved the case down the stairs of my building and out onto the street,

“Hey!” Chris called as he appeared by my side and took the case from my hands, he lifted it easily into the back of his car. Dodger’s head popped up from the back seats to look into the trunk of the car as my case was push in next to Chris’.

“Hey bud,” I greeted and he made a low, quiet noise in way of response and disappeared back behind the seat.

“You ready for this?” he asked me as he closed the door of the trunk, he watched my face closely.

“In the same way anyone can be ready for something their not ready for,” I replied shrugging. He gently placed his hand on my arm.

“Whatever happens, I’m here okay?” he said, his large hand warm on my arm.

I nodded and swallowed hard, took a deep and steadying breath before heading for the passenger seat door. I slid into the oversize leather seat and clipped in my seat-belt, Chris slid in beside me and started the engine.

“Is what I’m wearing okay to meet your parents,” he asked, looking down at himself. He had on a pair of pale blue jeans and a dark blue t-shirt, his cap was on backwards today and there was a pair of sunglasses on perched on the top of his head.

“You look great,” I replied, he did, but then again he looked great in whatever he had on.

“What tux did you choose?” I asked as we pulled away from the curb and headed down the street.

“Black velvet, I know its your favourite,” he replied, glancing at me and winking, I laughed but he was absolutely right and I was thrilled by bis choice.

“We are going to be the best dressed couple there,” I said with a grin on my face, “oh and just wait until I tell you about what my sister text me the other day,”

I proceeded to explain to Chris that my entire family thought he was my boyfriend which made him crease up with laughter and helped ease a little of the anxiety that had build up in my stomach.

“Dad will give you a total grilling when we get there,” I said, as he cruised along the freeway, “he’ll want to know if you can fish and track and chop your own firewood, he’s a real mans man,” I added.

“Oh lordy,” Chris said with a laugh, “we should turn around now because I am going to be such a disappointment to him,”

“You and me both then,” I replied, laughing as well, but I quickly got lost in my own thoughts again.

“Penny for them?” Chris asked after a few minutes of silence.

“Oh just thinking about the last time I saw my parents,” I replied, glancing over my shoulder at the back seat where Dodger was resting his head in his paws.

“Wanna tell me about it? Because, you know, we’ve never talked about what happened with them,” he asked glancing over at me.

“Do you remember that girl I was seeing for a while, two years ago?” I started, my hands wringing together in my lap.

“Yeah I remember her, she moved back west didn’t she?”

I nodded, feeling a burning sensation climbing up my throat, I had never talk about this, not with anyone.

“Well, my parents dropped in on us unexpectedly and well, they weren’t overjoyed with the idea of me being in a same sex couple,” I paused for a second and swallowed hard, “I guess I had never come out to them and it would have never had crossed their mind that their daughter would have been anything but straight,” Chris nodded encouragingly but didn’t speak, giving me the space to continue.

“And they’re Catholics and I think the way they reacted was shock more than true malice but- it doesn’t change the fact they did hurt me, but I think they didn’t know how to handle it and neither did I and we just made a total mess it of,”

“I don’t think you made a mess of things,” Chris said after a few moments of silence, “you were being honest about who you are,” I considered his words for a moment.

“But my hand had been forced,” I said, “Maybe what hurt them most was that I had never been honest with them before that moment when the truth was out their already,”

He shrugged, “Maybe,” he mused, “but still, they shouldn’t have been cruel to you,”

“Like I said, I think it was shock, but no, they shouldn’t have,”

“And that’s what this all comes down to huh? Because they don’t like that you’re bi?”

It was my turn to shrug now, “I guess so, seems stupid when you say it like that,”

Chris reached out and put his hand over mine and squeezed gently, his hands were warm and soft and felt comforting on my skin.

“If they can’t get over that and love you for who you are then they don’t deserve you,” he said quietly, lifting one of my hands from my lap and bring it to his lips, he kissed the back of my hand gently before letting it go so he could use the turn signal.

My skin flush red hot where his lips had touched it and there was a quivering feeling in my belly.

We stopped about two hours into the journey to give Chris a break and give Dodger a chance to stretch his little legs. In the small convenience shop I stocked up on chocolate and sweets, knowing that I was unlikely to find any treats at my parents place.

Back in the car I pulled open a bag of MnM’s and offered them to Chris, he took a handful and threw them in his mouth.

“Ready?” he asked again as he started the engine, I nodded and popped some more candies into my mouth.


Much love! Hit my ask box up! xx

“But my hand had been forced,” I said, “Maybe what hurt them most was that I had never been honest with them before that moment when the truth was out their already,”

He shrugged, “Maybe,” he mused, “but still, they shouldn’t have been cruel to you,”

“Like I said, I think it was shock, but no, they shouldn’t have,”

“And that’s what this all comes down to huh? Because they don’t like that you’re bi?”

It was my turn to shrug now, “I guess so, seems stupid when you say it like that,”

Chris reached out and put his hand over mine and squeezed gently, his hands were warm and soft and felt comforting on my skin.

“If they can’t get over that and love you for who you are then they don’t deserve you,” he said quietly, lifting one of my hands from my lap and bring it to his lips, he kissed the back of my hand gently before letting it go so he could use the turn signal.

My skin flush red hot where his lips had touched it and there was a quivering feeling in my belly.

We stopped about two hours into the journey to give Chris a break and give Dodger a chance to stretch his little legs. In the small convenience shop I stocked up on chocolate and sweets, knowing that I was unlikely to find any treats at my parents place.

Back in the car I pulled open a bag of MnM’s and offered them to Chris, he took a handful and threw them in his mouth.

“Ready?” he asked again as he started the engine, I nodded and popped some more candies into my mouth.


Much love! Hit my ask box up! xx
trail.content:
Chris Evans, not just a snack but a 4 course meal with coffee and mints.  

Taking my best friend to my little sisters wedding should be simple right? Well, it wont be.

Thursday morning rolled around far faster than I thought it would, before I knew it Chris was calling me telling me he was outside and waiting for me. I had packed and repacked my bag a dozen times in the last three days and the mess in my bedroom and in the living room was evidence to that fact, but my case was finally packed and I was as ready as I was ever going to be.

I heaved the case down the stairs of my building and out onto the street,

“Hey!” Chris called as he appeared by my side and took the case from my hands, he lifted it easily into the back of his car. Dodger’s head popped up from the back seats to look into the trunk of the car as my case was push in next to Chris’.

“Hey bud,” I greeted and he made a low, quiet noise in way of response and disappeared back behind the seat.

“You ready for this?” he asked me as he closed the door of the trunk, he watched my face closely.

“In the same way anyone can be ready for something their not ready for,” I replied shrugging. He gently placed his hand on my arm.

“Whatever happens, I’m here okay?” he said, his large hand warm on my arm.

I nodded and swallowed hard, took a deep and steadying breath before heading for the passenger seat door. I slid into the oversize leather seat and clipped in my seat-belt, Chris slid in beside me and started the engine.

“Is what I’m wearing okay to meet your parents,” he asked, looking down at himself. He had on a pair of pale blue jeans and a dark blue t-shirt, his cap was on backwards today and there was a pair of sunglasses on perched on the top of his head.

“You look great,” I replied, he did, but then again he looked great in whatever he had on.

“What tux did you choose?” I asked as we pulled away from the curb and headed down the street.

“Black velvet, I know its your favourite,” he replied, glancing at me and winking, I laughed but he was absolutely right and I was thrilled by bis choice.

“We are going to be the best dressed couple there,” I said with a grin on my face, “oh and just wait until I tell you about what my sister text me the other day,”

I proceeded to explain to Chris that my entire family thought he was my boyfriend which made him crease up with laughter and helped ease a little of the anxiety that had build up in my stomach.

“Dad will give you a total grilling when we get there,” I said, as he cruised along the freeway, “he’ll want to know if you can fish and track and chop your own firewood, he’s a real mans man,” I added.

“Oh lordy,” Chris said with a laugh, “we should turn around now because I am going to be such a disappointment to him,”

“You and me both then,” I replied, laughing as well, but I quickly got lost in my own thoughts again.

“Penny for them?” Chris asked after a few minutes of silence.

“Oh just thinking about the last time I saw my parents,” I replied, glancing over my shoulder at the back seat where Dodger was resting his head in his paws.

“Wanna tell me about it? Because, you know, we’ve never talked about what happened with them,” he asked glancing over at me.

“Do you remember that girl I was seeing for a while, two years ago?” I started, my hands wringing together in my lap.

“Yeah I remember her, she moved back west didn’t she?”

I nodded, feeling a burning sensation climbing up my throat, I had never talk about this, not with anyone.

“Well, my parents dropped in on us unexpectedly and well, they weren’t overjoyed with the idea of me being in a same sex couple,” I paused for a second and swallowed hard, “I guess I had never come out to them and it would have never had crossed their mind that their daughter would have been anything but straight,” Chris nodded encouragingly but didn’t speak, giving me the space to continue.

“And they’re Catholics and I think the way they reacted was shock more than true malice but- it doesn’t change the fact they did hurt me, but I think they didn’t know how to handle it and neither did I and we just made a total mess it of,”

“I don’t think you made a mess of things,” Chris said after a few moments of silence, “you were being honest about who you are,” I considered his words for a moment.

“But my hand had been forced,” I said, “Maybe what hurt them most was that I had never been honest with them before that moment when the truth was out their already,”

He shrugged, “Maybe,” he mused, “but still, they shouldn’t have been cruel to you,”

“Like I said, I think it was shock, but no, they shouldn’t have,”

“And that’s what this all comes down to huh? Because they don’t like that you’re bi?”

It was my turn to shrug now, “I guess so, seems stupid when you say it like that,”

Chris reached out and put his hand over mine and squeezed gently, his hands were warm and soft and felt comforting on my skin.

“If they can’t get over that and love you for who you are then they don’t deserve you,” he said quietly, lifting one of my hands from my lap and bring it to his lips, he kissed the back of my hand gently before letting it go so he could use the turn signal.

My skin flush red hot where his lips had touched it and there was a quivering feeling in my belly.

We stopped about two hours into the journey to give Chris a break and give Dodger a chance to stretch his little legs. In the small convenience shop I stocked up on chocolate and sweets, knowing that I was unlikely to find any treats at my parents place.

Back in the car I pulled open a bag of MnM’s and offered them to Chris, he took a handful and threw them in his mouth.

“Ready?” he asked again as he started the engine, I nodded and popped some more candies into my mouth.


Much love! Hit my ask box up! xx

I had packed and repacked my bag a dozen times in the last three days and the mess in my bedroom and in the living room was evidence to that fact, but my case was finally packed and I was as ready as I was ever going to be.

I heaved the case down the stairs of my building and out onto the street,

“Hey!” Chris called as he appeared by my side and took the case from my hands, he lifted it easily into the back of his car. Dodger’s head popped up from the back seats to look into the trunk of the car as my case was push in next to Chris’.

“Hey bud,” I greeted and he made a low, quiet noise in way of response and disappeared back behind the seat.

“You ready for this?” he asked me as he closed the door of the trunk, he watched my face closely.

Masterlist

summary:
The vows I just wrote for Chris to say to Seb in my story are more beautiful than my own will ever be and I hate that 😂
"Today I...
body:
The vows I just wrote for Chris to say to Seb in my story are more beautiful than my own will ever be and I hate that 😂


“Today I stand here before you and in this moment I’ve never been more sure of my destiny. I’ve been fortunate enough to have a wonderful career, I’ve made lots of friends, and been around the world a time or two. But none of that holds a candle to this moment. All of that is past. This. This moment right here is present. And you, standing in front of me. You’re my future. All of the trials of my life and decisions up until now have led me to you. And in the moment when I came around the corner to see you. When our eyes met, it was like a halo of light shined around you. Only confirming it even more. Sebastian, you are my destiny. If I never do anything else in life I’ll feel fulfilled because I’ve gotten the chance to love you. You are the one who I was separated from at the beginning of time. You are my soul mate. If reincarnation is a thing, you are the one who I will continue to find and fall for in every life. For the rest of eternity because I am not whole without you. You complete me.”
